text: <@U0PB67X4K> hey, quick question. when i build for fabric, at the end of the behave tests, do i need to ctrl+c out of it because it hangs with the following message:

text:
Hi <@U2B4QU7U3> -   

if you just want to build the Docker images locally, you can just run `make docker`

if you are making changes to the Fabric code and want to test locally, just run `make unit-tests`

I never run `make all` locally as I'm pretty sure the BDD tests still fail these days
<@U0PB67X4K> i should do make docker within vagrant as well? when i make all locally i get this. : <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/karnn/F3KF02D7A/building_fabric_without_vagrant.txt>

file.name: Building_fabric_without_vagrant.txt
file.title: Building fabric without vagrant
file.preview:
[karn@localhost fabric]$ make dist-clean all
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-peer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-orderer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-ccenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-javaenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
file.preview_highlight:
[karn@localhost fabric]$ make dist-clean all
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-peer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-orderer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-ccenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-javaenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'

text: <@U0PB67X4K> so i should make docker locally instead of make all
yeah - I would not go with `make all` for now.   I believe the error you are getting locally is because you are running a downlevel of Go - for V1.0 we require Golang 1.7 and higher
<@U0PB67X4K> you're right. it's 1.6. thanks so much. one quick question, i've used sawtooth in the past and was wondering if it was as easy to set up a marketplace with fabric as with sawtooth.

<@U2B4QU7U3> - fabric does not currently have the concept of a marketplace.  I hesitate to say if there is a "equivalent" capability, but basically one you get the hang of writing chaincode it's pretty easy to add your own types of transactions / processing logic to the fabric
<@U0UHG4VP1> there seems to be an intermittent CI job failure lately, see this for example (and the same happens to other changesets in other projects): <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3569>

<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3663/>
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3665/>

Added <@U0KPFAZNF> for review, but wasn't sure who else was interested in reviewing dev-env changes, so if anyone here would like to, would appreciate it.
